returnType: The CURRENT_TIMESTAMP function returns a TIMESTAMP WITH TIME ZONE value.
description: The Oracle/PLSQL CURRENT_TIMESTAMP function returns the current date and time in the time zone of the current SQL session as set by the ALTER SESSION command. It returns a TIMESTAMP WITH TIME ZONE value.
sample:
ALTER SESSION SET TIME_ZONE = '-7:0'; select CURRENT_TIMESTAMP
from dual; 10-Sep-05 10.58.24.853421 PM -07:00 ALTER SESSION SET TIME_ZONE = '-2:0'; select CURRENT_TIMESTAMP
from dual; 10-Sep-05 03.58.24.853421 AM -02:00
